item.title: Not this time, Next.js
item.description:
It’s been a minute since I’ve logged activity. I’ve been focusing on research and prepping for some technical interviews. It’s the kind of activity that doesn’t lend itself to those nice green squares on GitHub. But I’ve made some architectural breakthroughs during that process.

Iâ€™ll start by saying, I fully intended to use Next.js for my project rebuild. The more I’ve researched it, the better it seems for building performant, SEO-optimized web apps. You gain so many UX and DX benefits: smaller bundles, intuitive routing, server-side data fetching, and improved security, to name a few.
